fun_fact: The show Psych was inspired by creator Steve Franks' love for detective shows and his relationship with his father.
James Roday Rodriguez, who plays Shawn Spencer, co-wrote many episodes and even directed several of them.
Dulé Hill, who portrays Burton 'Gus' Guster, is an accomplished tap dancer and showcased his skills in multiple episodes.
The iconic pineapple became a running gag on Psych after it was ad-libbed by James Roday in the pilot episode.
Psych is set in Santa Barbara, California, but it was actually filmed in Vancouver, Canada.
The character Lassiter’s full name is Carlton Jebediah Lassiter, a fact that’s revealed later in the series.
The Psych office's phone number is 1-800-555-0199, a commonly used fake phone number in TV shows.
Maggie Lawson, who plays Juliet O'Hara, and James Roday Rodriguez dated in real life during much of the show's run.
Each episode of Psych has at least one hidden pineapple somewhere in the scene or dialogue.
Timothy Omundson, who plays Lassiter, originally auditioned for the role of Shawn Spencer.
Cary Elwes, known for his role in 'The Princess Bride,' made guest appearances as the master thief Pierre Despereaux in several episodes.
The theme song 'I Know You Know' was performed by The Friendly Indians, a band led by show creator Steve Franks.
The character of Gus is known for having several obscure nicknames, like 'Lavender Gooms' and 'Ghee Buttersnaps,' which Shawn makes up throughout the series.
The 'Psych-Outs' at the end of many episodes feature the cast and crew having fun or breaking character while filming.
The actor who plays Shawn’s father, Corbin Bernsen, was cast partially because he was Steve Franks’ childhood TV hero.
In Season 5, 'Dual Spires' is an homage to the cult TV show 'Twin Peaks,' with many of the original cast guest-starring.
Psych ran for eight seasons and inspired three reunion movies: 'Psych: The Movie' (2017), 'Psych 2: Lassie Come Home' (2020), and 'Psych 3: This Is Gus' (2021).
One of the show's most famous guest stars, John Cena, plays Juliet's brother Ewan O'Hara, who is a highly-trained military operative.
The characters of Shawn and Gus frequently reference 1980s pop culture, a nod to the childhood nostalgia of the show's creators.
Psych was one of the first USA Network shows to engage heavily with fans through social media, creating a strong fanbase known as 'Psych-Os.'
